summary: An email from a paralegal specialist at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY to colleagues, providing an update on outstanding document requests related to Jeffrey Epstein's death. It discusses the location of commissary reports, missing SHU post order review sheets, and incomplete daily assignment rosters for a critical time period.

persons.name: Paralegal Specialist
persons.context: Author of the email, working through outstanding document requests for the U.S. Attorney's Office related to the Epstein death investigation.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; the email discusses locating his commissary records and other BOP documents from the period around his death.

connections.description: The paralegal is gathering Bureau of Prisons records related to Epstein's incarceration and death as part of an official investigation.

events.title: Critical Document Period for Epstein Death Investigation
events.description: The time period for which daily assignment rosters and other prison records were requested by the U.S. Attorney's Office, encompassing the date of Epstein's death.

events.title: Update on Outstanding Document Requests
events.description: A paralegal specialist provides an update on the status of gathering Bureau of Prisons records related to Epstein's death, noting missing documents.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office SDNY, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Shared network drive: \\usa.doj.gov\clouanys\StAndrewASharealnReEpsteinDeath-2019R01059\ Evidence Epstein General BOP Records
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's death in September 2019, seeking specific prison records.
Commissary reports for Epstein and other inmates (initials EM, M) were located on a shared drive, but consisted of only a single 'truview' page without detailed receipts.
Key documents, specifically signed SHU (Special Housing Unit) post order review sheets, were missing and could not be found by the paralegal.
Daily assignment rosters for the SHU were also incomplete for the requested period of July 1 to August 10, 2019, which includes the date of Epstein's death (August 10, 2019).
